Confirmation from the Nebraska Departmen: The communications director for the Nebraska Department of Health and Human Services confirmed that no shipments of the COVID-19 vaccine were received before FDA approval, and officials could not order the vaccine prior to approval.
Official statements and announcements: The FDA announced on December 11 that it had approved the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine. On December 14, the Nebraska Department of Health and Human Services announced that the first doses of the Pfizer vaccine had arrived in Nebraska.
Vaccine distribution process: The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services website outlines the vaccine approval and distribution process, stating that distribution begins 24 hours after the Emergency Use Authorization. The first deliveries of COVID-19 vaccines began on December 14, 2020.
Lack of news coverage: Despite searching, no news coverage was found of any vaccines arriving in Nebraska before they were approved by the FDA.
